meanings.definition: Convenient or easily accessible for use
meanings.sent1: Having a handy tool can make fixing things easier.
meanings.sent2: It's handy to have a flashlight during a power outage.
meanings.sent3: He always keeps a handy snack in his backpack for emergencies.
meanings.sent4: Her quick thinking was as handy as a Swiss Army knife in that situation.
meanings.sent5: The map was a handy guide through the maze-like streets of the city.

meanings.definition: Skilled or adept with one's hands
meanings.sent1: The handy carpenter built a sturdy table in no time.
meanings.sent2: She is very handy when it comes to knitting beautiful scarves.
meanings.sent3: The handy artist painted a masterpiece with delicate brush strokes.
meanings.sent4: His hands were as handy as magic wands, creating wonders.
meanings.sent5: Watching him sculpt clay was like witnessing a handy magician at work.

meanings.definition: Ready or able to help or assist
meanings.sent1: The handy neighbor always lends a helping hand when needed.
meanings.sent2: It's great to have a handy friend who can offer support in tough times.
meanings.sent3: The handy volunteer spent hours assisting at the local shelter.
meanings.sent4: Her advice was as handy as a compass, guiding him through the decision.
meanings.sent5: The firefighter's bravery was a handy shield against the raging flames.
